No hostility meant! Al, why do you think we are limited to this time/space =
universe? Even Hawking refers to the cosmos as a multiverse. When conscious=
ness is involved, the only limits are the ones you press upon yourself. The=
 only boundaries are the ones you build. We are so quick to give things mea=
ning and definition but what do we truly know about existence. At one time =
philosophy and science were one until it was deemed we needed a more struct=
ured and disciplined approach to "figuring things out", hence the birth of =
the scientific method. 

Natural law is what we all agree it is!



_______=
_________________________
From: "threadsintyme@..." <Threadsintyme@Jun=
o.com>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, November 13, 2008 3:29:0=
1 PM
Subject: Re: Re : [EVP-ITC] Proofs for spirit world?


I have a questi=
on that everyone might disagree with...perhaps not. Where does this leave N=
atural Law? 
You are right, Zack...because we are limited to this time/spac=
e universe. On the other hand, spirits (however you wish to refer to the de=
ceased) are definetly not limited to this single universe as the living are=
. They become (I believe) non-localized entities. The living are localized.=
.. to the here and now. 
These are just some thoughts to share...not meant =
to cause any hostility, etc. 
Kimberly,
What do you think abhout non-locali=
zed entities?
Al

-- Zack Widup <w9sz@prairienet. org> wrote:

<<But we are=
 definitely dealing with the non-physical here, so any ideas 
that try to c=
orrelate a spirit to something physical can be thrown out the 
window. Whil=
e it is true that they appear to be coexisting in the physical 
universe, t=
here's no reason to assume they are limited by it.>>

I have dozens of EVP =
I've gotten in the former Manteno State Mental 
Hospital in Illinois. And y=
ou know what? Whatever made those EVP's still 
seems to be crazy. And these=
 were apparently made by spirits who no longer have physical bodies. So muc=
h for the idea of "chemical imbalances in the brain" being the root of insa=
nity! A ghost doesn't have a brain.

I think Hamlet summed it up the best:
=

"There are more things in heaven and earth, Horatio, than are dreamt of in=
 
your philosophy."

I constantly remind myself of that.

Zack

On Thu, 13 =
Nov 2008, Frank Ratka wrote:

> I have no idea what you are talking about, =
angels? pins?! Anyway, applying earth's physical sciences to attempt to exp=
lain=A0a phenomenon that has shown no evidence of=A0roots in the physical i=
s an exercise in futility and pointless.
>
> Regards,
>
> Frank R.
